7.5.0.1. Document Account Announcements Report

  


Requirements

TODO_VA / TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 12/30/2025: Update this since we are working on the "Announcement" records and sending the emails from Silverloom. 

  


TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 12/12/2025: Move this to the appropriate Reports subsection when speccing for it winds down.

  


Overview: This is a custom report of Primary address information for Accounts, based on Account records, with various filters. This report is used to generate an Excel file for direct mailings, with a special feature that adds rows to the "Announcements for Account" embedded spreadsheet on Account records.  

  


Accessed from: Advanced | Announcements | Document Account Announcements (opens the filter screen) 

  


Title: Document Account Announcements 

/J: Tim Reitz 12/12/2025: Now that we're sending emails, change to "Send..."? Or "Send / Document..."? Or ??

/J: Tim Reitz 01/01/2026: Let's include the Announcement Title & Type. 

TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 01/15/2026: Actually, I think this report would be called "Add Recipients" or something like that. We'd need to overhaul the overview and the spec. 

  


Preface: N/A

  


Columns: 

  * Account # (link to open the record) 
  * Primary Account Manager Name (displays the "Short Display Name") 
  * Address (displays the "Address" (line 1) for the Contact's Primary address)
  * Line 2 (displays the "Address 2" for the Primary address) 
  * City, State, Zip (displays in the following format: "<City>, <State abbreviation> <Zip>", i.e. "Hutchinson, KS 67501") 



  


Row-Specific Buttons:

  * N/A



  


Grouped by: Account Reseller

  


Sorted by: Account # (lowest number at the top) 

  


Filters: 

  * Account Group (optional; multi-select drop list of all Account Group "Names"; defaults to all selected)
  * Account Reseller (optional; multi-select drop list of all active Account Resellers; defaults to all selected) 
  * Primary Account Manager (blank = all) (optional; drop list of all active "Primary" Account Managers; defaults to blank = all )
  * Account Status (multi-select drop list of "Account Statuses" list items; defaults to all except "Closed" selected)



  


Buttons: 

  * Export Addresses / Document Announcement (opens the "Export Addresses / Document Announcement" child screen, with the following: 
    * Prompts: 
      * __



TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 01/01/2026: With the new Announcement record, this would just show a preview before exporting / sending & linking. 

  * Data entry prompts: 
    * Prepared Date (required; date; defaults to the current date) 
    * Type (required; drop list of "Announcement Types" list items; defaults to blank)
    * Category (required; drop list of "Announcement Categories" list items; defaults to blank) 
    * Announcement Title (required; plain text; defaults to blank) 
    * Additional Notes (optional; plain text; defaults to blank) 
  * Continue (button; clicking this button does the following: 
    * runs an export report to immediately download an Excel file of the filtered Accounts; 
    * adds a row to the "Announcements for Account" embedded spreadsheet on all Accounts included in the report/Excel export, with the following set: 
      * "Prepared Date": sets to the contents of the corresponding data entry prompt;  
      * "Category": sets to the contents of the corresponding data entry prompt; 
      * "Announcement Title": sets to the contents of the corresponding data entry prompt; 
      * "Additional Notes": sets to the contents of the corresponding data entry prompt;
      * __



Tim Reitz 12/06/2025: Update this if we end up sending the emails from Silverloom. 

TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 12/09/2025: If Glen wants to send the emails, we would use an email merge that runs the same way (Modify Record After Export). 

TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 12/11/2025: Glen does want to send emails.

TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 12/16/2025: Now that we are working toward an Announcement record, this report would get data passed through from the Announcement record. For email, would kick off the email merge & set the recipients RG. For direct mail, would generate the Excel file & set the recipients RG. 

  


Menu Visibility: 

  * Users with the "Full Access" Permission (by virtue of the menu option being on the "Advanced" Menu)



_GZ: Tim Reitz 12/06/2025: Who would be the users who can do this? Only Master Administrators? 

_VA: Tim Reitz 12/11/2025: Per Glen today, there are things to consider in allowing Group Admins & Resellers do this. Probably OK for top Group Admins. Probably not for downline group Group Admins.

[X] For now, only allow Master Administrators / "Full Access" users to do this. This is the easier implementation.

TODO_T/J: Tim Reitz 12/11/2025: Add a possible future item to consider allowing others to send these contacts / accounts under their jurisdiction.

  


Other Notes:

  * N/A



  


Development Specification

Tim Reitz 12/09/2025: For adding the RG rows:  Nic said that this can be done if the button opens an export report (which downloads immediately), with a Modify Records After Export (either Modify Records Expression, not actually an x30, or run the x30): 

![](data:image/png;base64,) 

Nic advocates for the Modify Record Expression (not x30). If we have speed concerns we can switch to x30. 

Clicking the button would run a report with all the same ask prompts as the main report.
